intro: Turbinicarpus schmiedickeanus nothosubsp. ascocalyx, commonly known as the Ascocalyx Turbinicarpus, is a unique cactus species native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense covering of white to pale green spines. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking contrast to its otherwise muted appearance. Its leaves are reduced to tubercles, a common adaptation to minimize water loss in harsh environments. This nothosubspecies is a result of hybridization between T. schmiedickeanus and T. humilis, leading to distinct morphological traits.
